If it hadn't been so hot we could have also walked to dinner, which was near the sculpture garden. The rental was clean and quiet and located in a neighborhood with beautiful historic homes. Michael provided detailed instructions and even gave us some suggestions for places to go in the neighborhood. We would definitely stay here again when visiting the area.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Michael’s communications via Airbnb were very friendly, nice and hospitable before our arrival. He was extremely generous to accommodate a late checkout for us, which was truly kind and immensely helpful on our long road trip. The unit is designed well and decorated nicely. It has a hip and cool vibe to it. It’s private. It’s an apartment above a garage type building behind the main house with dedicated parking off the alley.
Sadly we think his cleaning team was having an off day, cause the unit was not clean upon our arrival. It’s clear that they made the beds and switched out the towels, but the sinks, toilet, shower, floors, etc looked like they hadn’t actually been cleaned at all. Which was kinda gross. We alerted the host to the issue immediately.
Also both sinks need plumbing help, and leak water from the faucets.
It’s too bad, cause if it had been cleaned properly, it would have been a nice place to stay.

review_text:
Michael’s place was great and absolutely would recommend to anybody looking for something walkable in downtown Des Moines.
If I have to stretch to find something to mention at all critically, I personally had some trouble getting the AC unit to work the way I intended. I couldn’t figure the damn thing out at all. It wasn’t until morning that my girlfriend pointed out that there was a remote control for it and she had moved it shortly after we had arrived, so mystery solved. Also, when entering the unit you’ll have a fairly steep set of stairs to climb. It didn’t bother me at all, but I could see older guests that wanted to come and go a lot, might have a little trouble there. Keep in mind, I had to DIG to mention those as negatives. Wonderful space, awesome location, and great host. Plus, it is affordable priced and doesn’t hide expense in junk fees.

review_text:
We live in the Des Moines metro, but we were invited to the Garden Gate Spring Gala. This organization provides a safe place for exploited women and their children away from the harsh realities of human trafficking.
My wife and I decided that we would make a date night out of the event, and decided that Michael's carriage would be the place we would go to get ready, and also relax after the gala.
Michael was very communicative from the beginning, which was great letting us know our rental was coming up, where a wonderful neighborhood grocery store is, and the amenities he provides.
The communication alone was enough to give Michael a stellar review.
We arrived at the Carriage House so we could get ready for the gala, a what a wonderful place to be. I wrote more, but ran out of characters, so in short stay here and you will not regret it.
Thank you Michael!

Michael left a spot in his driveway for us so we didn’t have to worry about street parking. He was quick to respond. My boyfriend and I were sad that we only booked one night and hopefully plan to return on our next trip to Des Moines for more than one night!

We were able to eat our snacks & drinks & the S’mores makings our host provided. LOVED!!
We would have used a microwave but were fine with what we had and did go out to eat at a BBQ place within a mile or two.

review_text:
Great upscale camping experience. Bed was comfortable linens were clean and cozy. Warm blankets and pillows on the couch helped add to the ambiance.
Loved the fireside S'mores kit she provided, along with a bottle of wine for our anniversary. It was cooler weather, and the heater in the tent helped keep us comfortable and warm even with strong winds and rain outside.
We enjoyed our time in a natural setting. The composting toilet was different, but it worked for what we needed it for! You can hear traffic, but there's a fan and earplugs in the tent, too if you need them, and with the heater running, it was really no bother. My husband even enjoyed a quick outdoor shower, despite the cool temperature, and commented on how he loved the shower head and that the water was nice and warm!
Overall, it was a great, relaxing stay, just what we needed for some time away, and we would definitely come back again!

The outdoor shower actually has warm water and felt great after a lake visit, and the AC in the tent made it comfortable for sleeping. Our only issue was the campfire - could have used some drier wood/kindling, or should have brought some of our own. Other than that, we had a great time and would go again.

review_text: This was our first "glamping" experience, and our stay here made it a great one! The tent was very clean and comfortable with everything we needed for our stay, including extra bedding for the couch, air conditioning for comfort, a mini fridge for our food, and a solo stove for roasting. We were surrounded by trees for privacy, yet it was just a small walk down a path to get to the site. The outdoor shower provided the necessary privacy, but was a fun and unique experience. The only thing that was less than perfect was the traffic noise, but you are not too far from a big city so that is to be expected. All in all, we would highly recommend staying here!

The solo stove for campfires is absolutely top notch! No smoke in your eyes! The s'mores supplies are one of my favorite parts! Melissa is very responsive and a fantastic host.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: INCREDIBLE! We’re already in the Des Moines area, but wanted a little “staycation,” and this exceeded my expectations. Melissa gave very clear directions on how to get there, where to park, and how to access/use supplies provided (which were many). This is the definition of glamping—very clean and orderly, with a binder full of helpful info. Firewood & fire starters provided for the solo stove, a hand towel & hand soap in the outhouse, games, a rack and hangers for clothing, plenty of chairs and tabletops, a nespresso machine with pods and creamer. It seems every little detail was considered. Absolutely perfect—we’re already planning our next stay.

Stayed with kids
review_text: What a lovely mother/daughter getaway. I was thrilled to find a glamping option in the Des Moines metro with all the options- outdoor shower (Divine!), private composting toilet, a great firepit area and grill for camp food. The bed was very comfortable and I appreciated the thread count as a bedding snob. We brought an extra air mattress since we had five people, but would have been fine without it. The AC kept the tent very cool, almost chilly :) which made for a great night of sleep. I've referred no less than another 10-15 people to check out the rental. It's no wonder they're booked almost every day of the season. Such a great escape! For ideas- we spent the day at Saylorville lake swimming as well as viewing the bison and elk. There's also a flower farm and putt putt nearby.

This tent is truly what “Glamping “ is all about. The game changer for me was the air conditioning!! Omg.
She thought of every little detail. King size comfortable bed , very very clean , tv and streaming , games , a mini fridge , nespresso machine , smore supplies and oh , did I mention the bathroom ?? And outdoor shower ?? Very clean too.
The smokeless firepit was awesome and sitting out on the front porch in the morning, drinking coffee. I felt like I was deep in the forest , but we were not. Which was good. We felt very safe. I can’t say enough good things. We will definitely come back ! Do not hesitate to book this Glamping tent. Oh and the directions to get there were spot on.

Stayed one night
review_text: I'm going to lead with - it was amazing and I can't wait to go back! We arrived after dark and in the middle of a massive storm, so I didn't have high hopes for a glamping experience, but it was genuinely wonderful. The instructions to get there, where to park, and how to get in were all super easy (even at night in the rain). The tent is beautiful and clean and cozy. We had everything we needed, and listening to the rain was heavenly. In the morning we were able to enjoy a fire and a walk through the trees. I really feel like we need to talk about the outdoor shower though, because it. is. phenomenal. We were a group of three - one experienced "real" camper, one experienced glamper, and one "hotels only please" non-camper. This experience was top notch for all of us. Highly recommended!

review_text: This is the perfect getaway location without having to "rough it". My granddaughter had recently started asking to go camping and we decided to book the tent for a one night stay on our way to Nebraska as a trial run before doing an actual camping trip with a 3 year old, well this was the absolute best place to try out camping without sacrificing some comforts. The space was super cute and cozy, the firepit area was adorable (the smores kit was such a cute treat), the ac worked very well and the outdoor shower was an awesome experience and there was hot water (not just warm) the bed was comfy and the tv was good to have once the grand baby was ready to put on music videos on YouTube and dance her heart away. The king bed was comfy and the mini fridge came in handy. Dont forget to bring bug spray like the host recommends and a flashlight for night trips to the outhouse. we would definitely love to visit again for longer than one night.

We rented both the house and tent for a group of 12.
Plenty of wonderful spaces to gather together or retreat to privacy.
Heat in tent was remarkably easy and effective on a chilly night. Tent was close walking distance to the house and yet tucked away out of site.
Since we has the house as well we didn’t really use the toilet or shower at the tent. It was great for sleeping.
Woodsy feel but also really close to the highway. One night we heard simultaneously coyotes howling/barking and motorcycles racing on the highway. Interesting juxtaposition.

The huge, comfy bed had a dual controlled electric blanket so my hubby and I could adjust our own settings; the heater kept the tent warm and cozy so the blanket was just a bonus. The Solo Stove campfire ring meant no smoke... no itchy eyes or moving to avoid the smoke. The host even provided Smores ingredients! The TV streaming gave us wonderful options and great, free wifi connection. The outdoor area was gorgeous and we saw three turkeys walking in the woods. We loved our time here and will be back!

review_text: What a perfect and unique stay! The tent was super cute… everything you need for a nice little getaway. Everything was very clean and well maintained. The fire pit had comfy reclining chairs and a basket of wood and cooking sticks were all provided with the stay. Melissa even had an extra surprise of individually packaged essentials to make s’mores in the fridge! :-) loved the fact that we had access to power and water while staying in the woods in this cozy tent! We really enjoyed the outside shower! It was great after a hot day to be able to shower in the coolness of the evening! There was the perfect amount of privacy, well lit path and a super comfy bed! I would recommend this stay to anyone! Melissa had great communication prior to the stay, we didn’t need to reach out at all during our stay, because everything we needed was provided and we didn’t have any issues. We didn’t want to leave! Thank you for the best ‘glamping’ experience we could have asked for!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Katy's Airbnb was AMAZING. She was so easy to communicate with, and getting inside was easy with her clear instructions. Inside, everything was organized, clearly labeled, and easy-to-find. The space was just as described, with one bedroom and a cozy living/dining area. The kids' nook had toys, books, coloring activities, games, blocks, legos, and more to entertain my kids in the morning. There was plenty of space to put the twin floor mattress in the living area. Our dog traveled with us, and there were so many supplies available for her--and treats, too. The neighborhood was safe and walkable, with a path to a park/playground just a little ways down the cul-de-sac. The backyard had play structures for the kids. Katy was very flexible with us and extremely helpful when our son had to make an unexpected trip to the nearby Emergency Room. We would ABSOLUTELY stay again--I have never seen such an organized and well-stocked AirBnB! Thank you, Katy!

name: Rebecca

Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This place sets the gold standard for rentals. I want other AirBnB owners to come to Katy to learn how it's done. I thought the photos and description looked and sounded nice, but the place is even better in person.
The rental was super clean, extremely organized, and fully-stocked. Katy is extremely thoughtful in thinking through everything a guest might need and more- extra bedding, bath supplies, necessities for guests with babies or dogs, etc. Katy is very proactive with communication- emails with check-in instructions, binder of local recommendations, little laminated signs with instructions on how to operate lights, scan a QR code for a video tutorial on how to operate the Roku.
The owners clearly have lots of local pride in Des Moines and Iowa, and it shines through in the decor, books on local points of interest and hiking, etc.
Location is a family-oriented neighborhood with kids playing in the yard, gorgeous mature trees. Feels like staying at a family friend's house.

Stayed with kids
review_text: We stayed here with our three kids (5, 4, and 1) for a few days while in town for a wedding. The bed and futon were comfy, the space was homey and inviting, and the patio was the perfect place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the wildlife. Birds chirping, squirrels playing, turkeys wandering through, and even a deer made an appearance. There were plenty of kids toys appropriate for our kids’ ages, even the 1 year old, and a little nook under the steps that they loved. Everything was extremely clean. Kitchen is well-stocked for cooking. Plenty of extra towels and blankets available. You will hear the family/kids/dog upstairs at times (not an issue for us at all, and the host mentions this in the listing). We’re so glad we stayed here and if we’re in the area we will definitely stay again!

Sean and Katy were very gracious hosts. Their instructions before hand, as well as what they had on site was very helpful. The kitchen was fully furnished with everything you needed for cooking. They had games, toys, books and puzzles. There were even extras in the bathroom just in case anyone forgets something.
Their neighborhood is super quiet and it was so great to see all the wild turkeys, deer and the little bunny that made It’s home on the patio underneath the grill.
Both Sean and Katy were very helpful and friendly. Their description was thorough and accurate. all of my family felt safe and comfortable. It was a great stay and I would definitely recommend them and would stay there again in the future.

review_text: This place has a ton of little details that I would have never thought of! As someone who was on the road all day, stressed, and absent minded I really appreciate all of the signage everywhere. From how to open the lock (which I definitely needed lol), to where every amenity is located, to rule reminders, everything is laid out. There were a lot of amenities I didn’t use but appreciated like the pack and play, kid’s reading nook, crafts, games, books, local coffee, electric blanket, bath supplies, mosquito repellent, a bbq, and more! That doesn’t even include the amenities I did use! Very pet friendly and aside from some footsteps I actually couldn’t tell there were people living above us. It was also located in a very safe neighborhood. I would recommend this over a hotel, especially if you have pets or need additional/more private space!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a nice stay here in Des Moines. The apartment is comfortable and well equipped. It is a little tricky to get inside because you have to street park until you get inside the apartment to get the gate opener for the adjacent parking, which involves a door code, a lock box, an elevator fob and a door key. But the instructions are clear. Not sure there is anything that can be done to simplify the process. That said, the reserved parking spot is a great bonus.
The listing and pictures are very accurate. Comfortable beds and plenty of towels and linens. You can easily cook in the kitchen. All we did was breakfasts because of the good restaurants within easy walking distance of the apartment.
One thing to note. The apartment is an industrial design with exposed ducts, etc. The two bedrooms are basically open to the main living area in that the walls don’t go all the way to the ceiling in one, and the other has a narrow walkthrough. Fine for a couple, but not private for more.

name: Jordan
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place was an amazing pick for my birthday weekend. We loved most everything about it. The hosts gave clear instructions, and the place was easy to find and access.
There was an issue with one of the windows near one of the bedrooms and that made regulating the temperature of the place (it didn’t help that it was February). There was also one morning we went to our car through the back entrance nearest the parking lot, and a homeless person was laying in the entry way. It wasn’t a huge issue, just a little awkward. We also were not able to access the patio because the latch was broken.
Otherwise we loved everything. The decor is modern and rustic, the view was incredible, and it was a 2 minute walk to some of our favorite bars and restaurants. Everything was fully stocked, and we were thankful for that when we realized we’d forgotten a few things. All in all, it was a very positive experience, and I would have given it a 4.5/5 but the app doesn’t recognize half points lol.

2. The flat is exactly as pictured, only BETTER. It was beautiful, the views were amazing, so quiet, and the location was walkable to everything!

If we ever make it back to Des Moines someday this will 100% be the place we stay! Thank you for your hospitality and opening your beautiful home to us!

Our only disappointment was that the Des Moines Farmer's Market wasn't in session due to pandemic, but if it had been in session, this apartment would have been in a perfect location to walk to the market!

I’d highly recommend staying here if you’re in Des Moines!

Completely secure building with parking across the street, which is free after 9 pm if you catch the right spots. Walkable to wonderful restaurants and everything downtown Des Moines has to offer. My only note is the bedroom toward the back of the unit gets a fair amount of street noise. If you are a light sleeper, choose the front bedroom, or bring ear plugs for snoozing. But, honestly, very similiar to what you get in any urban loft space. HIGHLY RECOMMEND Dan & his place - awesome host, awesome space, great town! We'll stay again when we come back to Des Moines!

review_text:
The place was as described, and very conveniently located. My co-worker and I were in town for a conference. We were able to walk everywhere, and the central location of the condo was quite convenient. The space was very clean, and the layout worked well. The building, itself, could probably use some maintenance, but that's not the host's fault. It was a great stay, but I would advise that the bedroom closest to the street is a bit loud, as it is right over the street and some of the locals do enjoy riding their Harleys late at night. Not a deal breaker, but if you're a light sleeper I'd suggest sleeping in the interior room.
Otherwise, a great stay and Dan was very quick to respond and we had no issues during our stay.

I also didn’t like the inflexibility for check out when I asked to stay another couple of hours - even an hour - I was told no as the cleaner had to come five hours before the next guest checked in. Lastly, the mattress is really soft and not to my liking.

Location, location, location!!! Being in the Penthouse on the 12th floor affords some pretty spectacular views, especially at night with all of the colorful lights from the art installations below. The dining and night life options in the immediate area are excellent. DON’T MISS EL BAIT SHOP!!! We loved East Village and all of the awesome local shops and boutiques, sculpture park, dinner and Trivia Night at Quinton’s… and it was all a short drive or 15 min walk from the Penthouse.
The space itself is really fantastic. Beautifully appointed condo in a fantastic Art Deco building. Super high ceilings and gorgeous lighting, spacious layout and a pillow soft king size bed — it’s perfect in every way! And the garage parking with remote entry was a really nice touch as well.
If you’re headed to Des Moines, this is THE place!!!

Terry was very nice. I didn't meet Linda in person, but she seemed nice in message. I only had two issues:
1. This is NOT a private unit as described. It's an open basement. There is no locked door between myself and the hosts, which made me uncomfortable.
2. The beds were VERY uncomfortable 😣. I got almost no sleep because the mattress caused me so much back pain. I even had to go get pain medicine and a massage after check out because my back was spasming so bad (I don't lije taking pills).
Linda & Terry, thank you for hosting us. We really do appreciate it. But can you please update your listing to reflect a room for rent, as it's not a private unit. Also, if you have the money, I would recommend replacing the mattresses, or at least adding a topper. Thanks!

The room was clean, bed and mattress were great quality, bathroom was super clean, had warm and cold water, and toiletries.
Hosts speak and understand multiple languages including English.
The area is nice and quiet, close to gas station, local market, and lots of food options around.
I stayed there with my wife and an 8 years old, if I visit this city again, I will try to reserve this amazingly vibrant airbnb.

review_text:
I loved my stay at Linda's and Terry's so much!! Prior to my stay, Linda and Terry were very communicative in the check in process and in answering my questions. Upon my arrival, Terry was very welcoming and provided me with a brief overview/tour of the Airbnb.
The Airbnb itself was wonderful and very comfortable! The area was very spacious and clean. The bedroom was great with a cozy bed and a table to eat and do work. The restroom was very clean with fresh towels. In addition to the basic accommodations, this Airbnb had many additional amenities that distinguish it from others, this includes a small entertainment room with a TV and streaming services, access to the laundry room, and a small "kitchen" with mini fridge, microwave, and utensils. Lastly, the neighborhood and location of the Airbnb was so convenient! Downtown was only a 5-10 minute drive and access to the interstate was also very close by.
I'd also love to give a special shout out to Terry for being a wonderful host! Terry went above and beyond everyday to ensure I had a comfortable and pleasant stay. He always welcomed and greeted me with a smile. It was so great getting to know Terry throughout my stay with our conversations.
Thank you so much Terry, Linda, and Mylo (their dog) for a wonderful and memorable stay!

This house is in a perfect location, you can get to anywhere downtown within 5-10 mins! Linda & Terry had left for the weekend but checked in on us a few times to make sure we didn’t need anything and were warm enough. They had extra little heaters in the basement which was great! We love the little touches like the bathroom basket of misc items and the water stocked in the mini fridge & coffee kcups for us.
Only recommendation is this, yes the basement is private but it just that, a basement of a house. Foot steps and conversation from above can easily be heard. There is no door leading down to the basement just a curtain covering the door frame. We are two young girls and would have appreciated a locked door at the opening to the basement, especially because a man we didn’t know and wasn’t reviewed about on air bnb was “house sitting ” while Linda & Terry were gone.

They are a must stay and we will stay with them again when we visit Des Moines again!

The space is also lovely and like having your own apartment with a super comfy bed and a lot of thoughtful touches like a coffee maker, toiletries, and a steamer for clothes. Terry and Linda were traveling when I stopped by, but their friend Donnie was dog sitting and super accommodating and friendly. Yet even from afar, they did their best to resolve some issues I had with the wi-fi. If you’re looking for a colorful, convenient place to stay with charming hosts, I can’t recommend this Airbnb enough.

,

,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Our family was only in town for a quick overnight stay. We were able to check in a little earlier than planned! I was needing to have a pack n play for our 2 year old and when I reached out to Jesse whether the house had one, he didn’t hesitate one bit, and had one ordered to arrive at the house the day we were set to arrive. It was beyond accommodating as it was one less big thing I had to pack. That little gesture meant a lot to our family.
Our kids LOVED, LOVED, LOVED the theater room and not for watching movies, but for going from level to level. It was a way for them to get energy out after a drive. The hot tub was a wonderful addition as well. There was space for our family of 7. Our bigger kids enjoyed sleeping in the theater, which gave us ample room to spread out the babies. It was also so nice to see a box fan that our kids used at night to drown out any baby cries. We are keeping this house on our list as we come to Des Moines quite often. Thanks again Jesse!

Very cool and would definitely recommend!
Will keep saved as a favorite for our next road trip out west! Thank you Jesse!

We enjoyed both the movie room and hot tub. It’s a great place to go to relax and unwind with your significant other…. but if you must bring your kids there’s plenty of beds for them to sleep too! :) The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet and we enjoyed walking our dogs around the area. Loved the space and hope to visit again!

rating_info:

review_text:
Jesse's home was so fun! There were great amenities ( snacks, champagne when we arrived, ice maker, stocked coffee bar, grill utensils & seasonings to use ect ect!!) And we loved the decor. Each room has its own theme. The moon room was our favorite! The movie room downstairs was so enjoyable, the surround sound was amazing! The deck area was beautiful and perfect for a relaxing grilled meal. Definitely recommend the hot tub, it is relaxing and the jets are superb! From the glassware, the utensils, the rolled up towels waiting on our beds, the champagne waiting on arrival, to the fun bidets on the toilets, everything was very luxurious and thoughtful. Highly highly recommend the Coop! We will be back!
Jesse was also highly responsive and an amazing host!
